intro: Hydrostachys nana, commonly known as dwarf hydrostachys, is a small, mat-forming perennial plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with dense, dark green foliage that is often submerged or floating in shallow water. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and insects. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its compact size and adaptability, it is sometimes used in aquatic gardening or as a decorative plant in water features.
